lines.text: What's going on?
Murder... You want some?
Don't fuck with me, cock-knocker.

[voice over the phone, threatening Thad]
See if you can figure out where I'm calling from, Thad.
[hangs up]

[pauses a second, then realizes]
NO!

[Thad calls his own home]
That was quick, hoss.
Remember, when you fuck with me, you're fucking with the best.
Sounds like the police have been in touch.
They wanted me to confirm that you were a man of good character. I lied and told them that you were.
They've come to take one of us away, haven't they? Which one?
The loser, of course. I do hope it's not you, Thaddeus. I'd hate to think of George Stark taking over your lecture group.

[teaching]
Most of us keep that inner-being lock up, hidden away. A fiction writer doesn't have to do that. He doesn't have to hide it. He doesn't have to keep it from anything. He can let it out, bring it out into the open. Let it live, let it breathe. Hell, he can let it party - give it the car keys, let it ride!
Yes!
What's going on here?
Murder! You want some?
You are disturbing the peaceful mood I'm in. You are disturbing the peaceful frame of mind I'm in. You are disturbing my peaceful frame of mind.
You always were the clumsy one, old hoss.

[after slitting the throat of his literary agent, Rick Cowley, with a cut-throat razor]
I've decided to change agents. Sorry, Rick - it's a cut throat business.
I thought you knew about this stuff?
I don't know about of any of it, nobody does. Except the Almighty, and He seems to be on sabbatical.
You have my word - the word of a Southern man, which is not given lightly.
[last lines]
Wait! Wait here!
Ah! Ah! Aargh! Aargh!
Liz!
